Articles.Content:
This is the release thread for my ESA probe replicas made by Duna Aerospace.

These crafts use Tweakscale and Kerbal Joint Reinforcement

**Columbus Man Tended Free Flyer**

ESA station lifted by an Ariane 5

75 parts, costs 99,837

[http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Columbus-Man-Tended-Free-Flyer](http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Columbus-Man-Tended-Free-Flyer)

![223F4C0F5AF1DC4D70225A0193BDC5143992A710](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/1457265578247852026/223F4C0F5AF1DC4D70225A0193BDC5143992A710/)

**ATV**

ESA ISS resupply craft launched on an Ariane 5

67 parts, costs 77,279

[http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Automated-Transfer-Vehicle](http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Automated-Transfer-Vehicle)

![screenshot8.png](http://media-elerium.cursecdn.com/attachments/24/174/screenshot8.png)

**Mars Express/Beagle 2**

 ESA mission to Mars including a lander and orbiter on a Soyuz-Fregat

 112 parts, costs 48,488

[http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Mars-Express](http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Mars-Express)

![3A0F0DE34959EDBBD6D83F0721EA524310225CB2](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073084512516651/3A0F0DE34959EDBBD6D83F0721EA524310225CB2/)

![C8EC362169AC670BF4135881A3952148C11A1A99](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073084512518353/C8EC362169AC670BF4135881A3952148C11A1A99/)

 ![E6B3C59D67BD6326CD324FBA93DEE533389DC7F2](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073278208226864/E6B3C59D67BD6326CD324FBA93DEE533389DC7F2/)

**Rosetta/Philae**

 ESA mission to Comet 67p including a lander and orbiter on an Ariane 5

 104 parts, costs 73,973

[http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Mars-Express](http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Mars-Express)

![D2E457C840CC327A27214086D4A13B64CECB8D1E](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073278205324580/D2E457C840CC327A27214086D4A13B64CECB8D1E/)

![C66C2B29431865E5E1180C1B7689CD159CA03490](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073278205330996/C66C2B29431865E5E1180C1B7689CD159CA03490/)

![7CE94846F7C83B2A803A4A3D3CA8F38F5AEADA24](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073278208213650/7CE94846F7C83B2A803A4A3D3CA8F38F5AEADA24/)

**Venus Express**

 ESA mission to Venus on a Soyuz-Fregat

 105 parts, costs 45,749

[http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Venus-Express](http://kerbalx.com/clivman/Venus-Express)

![C1F9143D07A2B7A35E2BF4BEF5A9C4D79A0AF46B](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073278205321060/C1F9143D07A2B7A35E2BF4BEF5A9C4D79A0AF46B/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-23T02:00:06Z" title="08/23/2015 02:00  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 23, 2015</time> by clivman**

pretty cool ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

but they do science?

> 
> pretty cool ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> but they do science?

No they are designed for looks and functionality and so I do not use heavy science equipment unless it looks right on the probe. My Dawn replica has quite a few working instruments but these just have dummy ones.

Edit: Also

![B1CEAAF0E189C1AE6266CAA2FEC164F7D2AE6140](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073278206289914/B1CEAAF0E189C1AE6266CAA2FEC164F7D2AE6140/)

Now I just need Cassini

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-01T02:56:10Z" title="08/01/2015 02:56  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 1, 2015</time> by clivman**
Are those stock?

They have tweakscale- in stock you can either have high detail or correct scale and functionality. I wanted both.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-01T07:09:44Z" title="08/01/2015 07:09  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 1, 2015</time> by clivman**

> 
> They have tweakscale- in stock you can either have high detail or correct scale and functionality. I wanted both.

I disagree there mate. I think it's possible to get very close to correct scale with stock. If these where stock and you showed the launchers I think they would get more attention, that they deserve. I love the idea of a ESA pack. More people would dl it if it was stock.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-01T13:58:19Z" title="08/01/2015 01:58  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 1, 2015</time> by Majorjim**

> 
> I disagree there mate. I think it's possible to get very close to correct scale with stock. If these where stock and you showed the launchers I think they would get more attention, that they deserve. I love the idea of a ESA pack. More people would dl it if it was stock.

Thanks for the feedback, but I knew it wouldn't get as many downloads with tweakscale and KJR when I started this project and I'm sticking with that decision, plus, as it says on my page, I like building craft that aren't possible in stock.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-02T00:17:02Z" title="08/02/2015 12:17  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 2, 2015</time> by clivman**

> 
> Thanks for the feedback, but I new it wouldn't get as many downloads with tweakscale and KJR when I started this project and I'm sticking with that decision, plus, as it says on my page, I like building craft that aren't possible in stock.

No problem man. However, my ears always prick up when someone says "cannot be made in stock". What in this pack cannot be made with stock parts?

> 
> No problem man. However, my ears always prick up when someone says "cannot be made in stock". What in this pack cannot be made with stock parts?

Not in this one, but Sojourner-Pathfinder, Opportunity, and many of the probes parts are smaller the smallest parts in stock. Most solar panels can be made in stock but you cannot build working replicas of many of the probes with special solar panels because they are not deployable.

> 
> Not in this one, but Sojourner-Pathfinder, Opportunity, and many of the probes parts are smaller the smallest parts in stock. Most solar panels can be made in stock but you cannot build working replicas of many of the probes with special solar panels because they are not deployable.

Riight. Yeah to be honest a teeny tiny wheeled Sojourner would be absolutely incredible. Please make one! My own proclivities be damned!

> 
> Riight. Yeah to be honest a teeny tiny wheeled Sojourner would be absolutely incredible. Please make one! My own proclivities be damned!

I already did![45FB4ACC34306E0DD53D44BF371EF2140360A988](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073084512557445/45FB4ACC34306E0DD53D44BF371EF2140360A988/)

> 
> I already did[http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073084512557445/45FB4ACC34306E0DD53D44BF371EF2140360A988/](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073084512557445/45FB4ACC34306E0DD53D44BF371EF2140360A988/)

ha! cool. So how small is it? Can you take a pic of it near a Kerbal?
The octo 2 is actual size. I couldn't make Sojourner any smaller because of the root part bug in tweakscale.

> 
> The octo 2 is actual size. I couldn't make Sojourner any smaller because of the root part bug in tweakscale.

Dude tha'ts so cute! Please seat a kerbal on it or next to it. I need to see that picture!

Working on it

- - - Updated - - -

![DF14094C1CF99A25B214E427DD49A1C698564FE7](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073278209076361/DF14094C1CF99A25B214E427DD49A1C698564FE7/)

The poor little thing couldn't hold it's own weight on Kerbin so I had to push it off Pathfinder.

- - - Updated - - -

Here is Opportunity and Curiosity for comparison![3A7BEAB5810B700366FC4CB2537E2EA1D625370D](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/436073278209145015/3A7BEAB5810B700366FC4CB2537E2EA1D625370D/)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-01T19:57:49Z" title="08/01/2015 07:57  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 1, 2015</time> by clivman**
Awesome man! Its so dinky! Ahhh, those little wheels give me a warm feeling. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
I need to make Ariane 1 before I can finish this pack and I'm working on other replicas right now so it may take a while.

> 
> I need to make Ariane 1 before I can finish this pack and I'm working on other replicas right now so it may take a while.

Take your time mate. I can really see the allure of tweakscale.
Okay all of the European rockets are done so I can start on Giotto and Smart-1. Hermes shuttle will follow. (I already finished ATV and CMTFF, they are going through testing now)

Here is the ATV and CMTFF

![screenshot8.png](http://media-elerium.cursecdn.com/attachments/24/174/screenshot8.png)

![223F4C0F5AF1DC4D70225A0193BDC5143992A710](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/1457265578247852026/223F4C0F5AF1DC4D70225A0193BDC5143992A710/)

Now I just need Hermes
